node.statement: KERNEL ANALYSIS: The kernel ker(φ) consists of elements fixing each block setwise. Each block has 2 elements, so ker(φ) ≤ Sym({1,4}) × Sym({2,5}) × Sym({3,6}) ≅ (Z_2)³. Key observation: h₁² = (1 4)(3 6), h₂² = (1 4)(2 5), h₃² = (2 5)(3 6) are in ker(φ). These generate a subgroup {id, (1 4)(2 5), (1 4)(3 6), (2 5)(3 6)} of order 4. The kernel ker(φ) has exactly order 4: it contains products of even numbers of block transpositions, forming the Klein 4-group V_4 ≅ Z_2 × Z_2.
